H3147.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Gideon<SDBH:גִּדְעֹון>}, the judge of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} who is also known as {L:Jerubbaal<SDBH:יְרֻבַּעַל>}; tribe of {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}; ► known for the fable that he told about the inhabitants of {L:Shechem<SDBH:שְׁכֶם>}

H2568.def: = state in which a countable entity is five in number

H4427.def: = state in which humans or deities are in a position of royal authority over a group of people

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H8337.def: = state in which a countable entity is six in number

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H6659.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ahitub<SDBH:אֲחִיטוּב>}, descendent of {L:Aaron<SDBH:אַהֲרֹן>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► father of {L:Ahimaaz<SDBH:אֲחִימַעַץ>}; became high {L:priest<SDBH:כֹּהֵן>} under {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>} and {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}; with the {L:prophet<SDBH:נָבִיא>} {L:Nathan<SDBH:נָתָן>} anointed Solomon as {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}'s successor; officer in charge of his tribe

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H3477.def: = state in which objects are without a bend or curve

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H5818.def: = man, also known as {L:Azariah<SDBH:עֲזַרְיָה>}; ◄ son of {L:Amaziah<SDBH:אֲמַצְיָהוּ>}; tribe of Judah; ► father of {L:Jotham<SDBH:יֹותָם>}; king of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}, but became leprous after he burned incense in the temple

H1964.def: = a building or set of buildings, distinguished from other constructions or houses by its magnificence ► and function, which is either religious or political

H7843.def: = process by which objects are affected by violence, destruction, putrefaction, pollution, blemishes, and other factors that may have a destructive impact

H1129.def: = causative action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5945.def: = state of being in an elevated position

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2346.def: = structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside

H6077.def: always as K of {L:טְחֹרִים<SDBH:טְחֹרִים>}; exact meaning uncertain: = swelling of internal parts of the body or sores; ◄ probably due to an infectious disease such as dysentery or bubonic plague; ≈ regarded as painful, enfeebling and threatening to a community

H1129.def: = causative action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H1003.def: = a fortress that commands a city and is used in the control of the inhabitants and in defense during attack or siege.

H4026.def: = relatively high structure made of stone; ► used for guarding the surrounding area and/or for providing protection against hostile forces from outside; ≈ associated with security and protection

41.dom: Names of People|Names of Groups|Names of Locations

H3898.def: = action by which humans ingest food

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H5983.def: = nation; ◄ situated E. of river {L:Jordan<SDBH:יַרְדֵּן>}; according to {S:00101903800100200} founded by {L:Ben-Ammi<SDBH:בֶּן־עַמִּי>}, son of {L:Lot<SDBH:לֹוט>}

H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

H3967.def: = state in which a countable entity is one hundred in number

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H505.def: = generic term for domesticated oxen, both male and female; ► kept for milk and used for plowing

H3734.def: = a unit of both dry and liquid measure of approximately 220 liters; equals 1 {L:homer<SDBH:חֹמֶר>}

H2406.def: = cereal plant bearing dense four-sided spike of grain; ◄ Triticum; ► important source of flour for bread; ≈ its color used to be regarded as the ideal color for the skin

H8184.def: = a type of cultivated grass like wheat or rice; less than 1 m tall; it produces a single head on each stalk, with rows of kernels; ◄ Hordeum distichum or Hordeum vulgare; ► its grain was used to make bread or beer, or for animal feed

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H8145.def: = state in which a countable entity is the second in a range

H7992.def: = state in which a countable entity is the third in a range

H3147.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Gideon<SDBH:גִּדְעֹון>}, the judge of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} who is also known as {L:Jerubbaal<SDBH:יְרֻבַּעַל>}; tribe of {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}; ► known for the fable that he told about the inhabitants of {L:Shechem<SDBH:שְׁכֶם>}

H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3499.def: = what remains in existence after part of the original quantity has disappeared or has been used or dealt with in a certain way; used for humans, animals, plants, and inanimate objects

H3147.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Gideon<SDBH:גִּדְעֹון>}, the judge of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} who is also known as {L:Jerubbaal<SDBH:יְרֻבַּעַל>}; tribe of {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}; ► known for the fable that he told about the inhabitants of {L:Shechem<SDBH:שְׁכֶם>}

H4421.def: = armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3789.def: = action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

26.gl: The Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel and Judah

H4427.def: = state in which humans or deities are in a position of royal authority over a group of people
